data.title: Tobias Harris - Football 2022
data.meta_description: Football 2022 - Tobias Harris: The Official Athletics Website for the Old Dominion Monarchs.
data.text:
2022: Started all 12 games at corner ... Had 44 tackles, three tackles for loss and a sack ... Led the team with 11 pass breakups and had one interception ... Finished ninth in the Sun Belt with 12 passes defended ... Recorded an interception in the season-opening win over Virginia Tech.

A transfer from West Texas A&M

2021 (West Texas A&M): Earned first-team All-America and first-team All-Region honors ... Named to D2Football.com's Elite 100 ... Made 40 tackles on the year along with six interceptions, two returned for touchdowns, three pass breakups, 1.5 tackles for loss and a fumble recovery.

2020 (West Texas A&M): Started in two games at cornerback recording six tackles including a season-high five against Angelo State. Also had three kickoff returns for 62 yards.

2019 (West Texas A&M): Harris finished the season as one of the top returners in the nation as he ranked second in punt return average behind Alabama’s Jaylen Waddle. He averaged a DII best 22.9 yards per punt. He broke the single and career record for punt return yards on the game-winning return against Texas A&M-Kingsville. Recorded 19 punt returns for 436 yards and a touchdown while recording 571 kick return yards and a touchdown. On defense, he ranked third on the team in tackles (68) with four tackles for loss and a team-high four interceptions. He also ranked 15th nationally in pass breakups while recording his first career QB hurry. Recorded a career-high 11 tackles in the season finale against Midwestern State.

2018 (West Texas A&M): Lone Star Conference Freshman of the Year. All-LSC Honorable Mention (CB/RS). D2CCA All-Super Region Four 2nd Team (CB). Was one of the top returners in the country as his 819 return yards were the 9th most in Division II. He also had a 66-yard punt return for a touchdown against UT Permian Basin. Had a season long 72-yard punt return against Oklahoma Panhandle State. Also had a 72-yard kickoff return against Central Washington. On the defensive side of the ball, he recorded 48 tackles (40 solo, 8 assisted), 7 interceptions for 112 return yards and two touchdowns to go along with with 7 pass breakups. His 0.6 interceptions per game was the third-highest in the nation. He recorded his first multi interception game of this career in the season opener against Azusa Pacific. He followed that up with a pair of interception touchdown returns against Oklahoma Panhandle State and Western New Mexico. He also had interceptions against Central Washington, Angelo State and MSU Texas. Also recoded a season-high 8 tackles against Texas A&M-Kingsville.

Hendrickson High School: Graduated in 2018 where he played defensive back while returning punts and kicks for head coach Chip Killian. As a senior, he record 111 tackles, 84 of those of the solo variety, six interceptions and 327 punt return yards to earned all-state recognition. Also lettered in baseball, basketball and track & field.

Personal: Son of Toby and Shay’La Harris ... Two brothers, Shaun and Octavius.
